content: *in 2024 i made this rather lovely crochet quilt made up of mini hexies joined together to make flowers in the style of english paper piecing epp quilts this isn t a full and complete written pattern in my usual syle but i did want to bring together all the information i have about making these hexie flowers and show you how i m joining them into a quilt * **description** note this is not a written pattern as such but a series of video tutorials showing how i made my blanket see link below **skill level** *easy/intermediate* basic crochet stitches needed for the mini hexies joining is a little more tricky but i have a video to take you through it **yarn** *flowers* - i m using a mix of left-over and stashed 4ply/fingering weight minis *background* - drops baby merino in white 01 this is a sport weight yarn but works well with the 4ply/fingering weight yarns i used yarnsmiths merino sock also works well *substitutions* most yarns will work well for this choose a yarn that is suitable for your project **hook** 2 5mm i m using one size down from the recommended size use an appropriate size hook for your yarn - but you may wish to use a slightly smaller size hook as i have done to get nice tight hexies **size** one hexie flower is 10cm 4 across but this will vary with your yarn **border** this is optional i didn t add one but instead backed my blanket with fabric and added a fabric edging **videos** four tutorial videos to show *how to make a mini hexie how to make a hexie flower and join into a blanket how to make half hexies how to square off the ends of the blanket* additional video showing me applying backing and edging *hexie flower quilt backing & binding* all linked on pattern page below #cherryheart #hexieflowercrochetquilt
